    I hope this is useful; if you need more details about my system or such
please ask.

I downloaded the bundle eclipse-SDK-3.0.1-linux-gtk.zip from web.
Please disregard the bug report. I digged a little bit and saw I had no write
rights in the directory where I installed eclipse; after chnaging permissions on
the directory I was able to run it.
   Nicer error message would be nice though.


Sorry for the trouble and thanks,
Catalin
It is a weird error message, I guess we should punt this to core...

Assigning to Rafael since it is somehow related with "read-only" runs.
We also need to see if we can do a better job of reporting.

The same happens on current 3.1 builds.

There are two problems here: the first, the easiest to fix, is the error
message, which is too general. We know why we are throwing the error (could not
create directories), so that information should be provided in the message
somehow. The second is that since neither OSGi and Framework constructors
declare any exceptions, they end up wrapping any exceptions into
RuntimeExceptions, what will be a surprise for any callers. Tom, any chance that
can be changed so they throw a checked exception? I don't know what are the
backward compatibility requirements for that API.

BTW, this is what I get logged:

Old summary: "can not launch the platform (crash)"

Lowering severity.

I do not see a reason why we could not declare a checked exception on the 
constructors ...

This is not API.
Ok, cool. Opened bug 88217 for that.

Created an attachment (id=20657)
patch for org.eclipse.osgi

This patch chooses more specific messages when a directory cannot be created.
Tom, can you give a quick look?
